page.title: 05MUNDON FARMING PROBLEMS
page.content: THE SOIL Much of the farmland we surveyed was not particularly fertile and a lot of it was reclaimed Marshland. Freshfields Farm was bought in 1953.It was almost a wilderness and an awful lot of work had to be done before any profitable farming could be carried out. The land had to be drained and infilled.Dykes were dug and they lead to ditches which eventually drain into the Estuary.Then the land had to be infilled and Maldon Council dumped a lot of household rubbish there. Then a lot of topsoil had to be brought in and the land enriched with mushroom compost and other fertilizers. The fields then had to be reorganized so machinery could be used.This work is now complete. by Jenny, Tina, Philippa, Emma,Racheal
